ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The people of the city came, exulting at the news.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then came the people of the city, exulting at the news.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: In the meantime the people of the city came to Lot rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people of the town rejoicingly
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the people of the city came rejoicing. (* To the house of Prophet Lut.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the inhabitants of the city came rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the people of the town came rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the people of the city came, rejoicing at the news (of new arrivals).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The people of the town came along, revelling,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And there came the people of the city rejoicing
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The people of the city came, rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The inhabitants of the city came in (mad) joy (at news of the young men).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the inhabitants of the city came rejoicing (at the news of the young men's arrival).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The people of the city came to him rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the people of the town came joyfully.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:67] And then came the people of the city, the city of Sodom, that is, the people of Lot, upon being told that there were handsome clean-shaven individuals — namely, the angels — in the house of Lot, rejoicing (yastabshirūn is a circumstantial qualifier), desiring to commit an abomination with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the people of the city came) to the house of Lot, (rejoicing at the news (of new arrivals)) and at the prospect of engaging in their evil acts.
